reasoning:
Essay B demonstrates a higher level of proficiency across all aspects of Criterion B. Its research question, "What is the effect of changing the acid to conjugate base ([A-]/[HA]) concentration ratio (19, 3, 1, 0.333, 0.0526) on the buffering capacity of a Carbonate-Bicarbonate buffer solution...", is exceptionally focused and detailed, explicitly stating the independent variable's range and how the dependent variable will be determined. In contrast, Essay A's question, "How does the change in acid catalyst (HCl and H2SO4) affect the activation energy of the iodination of propanone?", is clear but lacks this level of specificity.

Furthermore, Essay B's methodology is more robust and demonstrates a higher level of experimental design. It employs a pH probe and a drop counter linked to data logging software, which allows for more precise and accurate data collection compared to Essay A's reliance on a stopwatch and "the naked eye" to determine the reaction endpoint. Essay B also provides a more comprehensive background, thoroughly explaining buffer systems, the Henderson-Hasselbalch equation, and two separate formulas for buffer capacity, creating a very strong theoretical foundation. While Essay A's background is relevant, it is less detailed.

Finally, Essay B's consideration of controlled variables and safety, ethical, and environmental aspects is more complete. It explicitly states "no ethical considerations were present," fulfilling the criteria, whereas Essay A omits any mention of ethics. Although Essay A's methodology is appropriate, its reliance on subjective visual observation and less precise equipment makes it weaker than Essay B's well-controlled, instrument-based approach.
